title.narrative: Inclusive Development Endeavour for Advancement of persons with disability (IDEA) Second Phase

description.narrative:
Since April 2015, CAFOD has been supporting ADD to deliver the Inclusive Development Endeavour for Advancement of persons with disability (IDEA) project. The project has been successful in mobilising people with disabilities, forming organisations and institutions and developing livelihood opportunities. This project is designed as a second phase to the IDEA project and will continue to strengthen the community groups, with this support these groups will continue to challenge discrimination, promote rights and social inclusion of people living with disabilities, and provide more support to establish livelihoods for people living with disabilities. The project will be implemented over 2 years (April 2017 - March 2019).
ADD Bangladesh’s ultimate goal is to create a grassroots movement of persons with disabilities throughout Bangladesh contributing to a vibrant disability rights movement. ADD mobilizes people with disabilities (PWDs) at the grassroots level by providing awareness, skills and leadership development training, and encouraging them to come together as self-help groups (SHGs) at the community level and DPOs at the union level.
The proposed project aims to empower persons with disabilities through strengthening DPOs as sustainable organisations by which the persons with disabilities can exercise their rights and have improved access to resources and services. The project will continue its works with the existing 86 Self Help Groups within 12 Disabled People's Organisations comprising 1,634 persons with disabilities in 12 existing unions under Patuakhali (Barisal division) and Bagerhat (Khulna Division) districts.
